FuncDef:
The slave batch-backup self-healing-timeout command sets the timeout period for system batch backup.
The undo slave batch-backup self-healing-timeout command is used to restore the system batch backup timeout as the default.
By default, the value of synchronization timed out(unit:minute) is 600.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the timeout period of batch backup.
The value is an integer ranging from 10 to 14400, in minutes.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The system components are backed up in batches in the master/slave main control board scenario. If the batch backup is not complete 5 minutes before the batch backup timeout period expires, an alarm is reported. If the batch backup is not complete within the timeout period, the slave main control board resets. Without this configuration, the timeout period for batch backup is 60 minutes, and the slave main control board is not restarted. If the configuration exists, the configured time is used as the batch backup timeout interval, and the slave main control board will be reset after batch backup times out.
